com.dukes.klein.scanner

Class KleinScanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dukes.klein.scanner.AbstractScanner<KleinToken>
      • com.dukes.klein.scanner.KleinScanner

  • public class KleinScanner
extends AbstractScanner<KleinToken>
    Scans through an Inputter and generates KleinTokens.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_VALUE

        public static final long MAX_VALUE
        The max value that an integer can be in Klein. This corresponds to 232 - 1.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MIN_VALUE

        public static final long MIN_VALUE
        The min value that an integer can be in Klein. This corresponds to 1 - 232.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • KleinScanner

        Makes a KleinScanner object. This will call the super's constructor.
        Parameters:
        input - The Inputter class to use.
        See Also:
        AbstractScanner

    • Method Detail

      • generateNextToken

        public KleinToken generateNextToken()
                             throws LexicalScanningException,
                                    LexicalAnalysisException
        Generates a KleinToken with the KleinTokenType found in the given spot in the Inputter. This, however, does not work if the Inputter finds an unknown character: this will throw an error. It also doesn't work if the EOF token is found without a comment ending, or if an integer is larger than the MAX_VALUE, or if an identifier is longer than 256.
        Specified by:
        generateNextToken in class AbstractScanner<KleinToken>
        Returns:
        The next KleinToken in the Inputter.
        Throws:
        LexicalScanningException - If an invalid character is encountered.
        LexicalAnalysisException - If EOF is reached without a comment ending, an integer is larger than the max value, or in an identifier is longer than 256 characters.

      • isDigit

        public static boolean isDigit(char c)
        Determines whether a single character is a digit within Klein.
        Parameters:
        c - The character to test
        Returns:
        True if the character inputted is 0 through 9

      • isLetter

        public static boolean isLetter(char c)
        Determines whether a single character is a digit within Klein.
        Parameters:
        c - The character to test
        Returns:
        True fi the character is between 65 and 90 OR 97 and 122
